head.supplied: 19 January 1880 ¶ [Thanks for copies of the work on the Forest Resources of Western Australia. ¶ Asks if the Marquis of Normanby ¶ and any Ministers of the Crown will be furnished with a copy]...

div.p: No. 735, vol. 1880 S, VPRS 1168/P inward correspondence registers, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Athens, 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
To proof.
Letter not found. According to my notes there are previous letters on this subject at Q5887, Q11845 and P11243. These numbers need to be looked at in registers. They may also be M letters – check their disposal notes also for clues as to where the entire file might be located.
19 January 1880

p.seg: [Thanks for copies of the work on the Forest Resources of Western Australia.

p.style: font-family: Athens, 'Times New Roman'; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

p.seg: Asks if the Marquis of Normanby

p.style: font-family: Athens, 'Times New Roman'; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

p.seg: and any Ministers of the Crown will be furnished with a copy]

p.style: font-family: Athens, 'Times New Roman'; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: Andy’s notes indicate there are several subsequent letters on this subject – R787, S824, S1091, S2996, R4938, R7149, and some toings and froings between CS and Lands. These numbers should be checked to see if any are M letters or letters that should be cited in notes to this one. Also Andy ultimately couldn’t work out how the file was disposed of – this needs to be checked again. It could be in lands (i.e. lost) but it looks to be about one of M’s books so is worth pursuing.
